c3py.axes¶

class c3py.axes.Axes¶

Manipulate the chart’s axes.

add_secondary_y()¶

Add a secondary y axis to the chart.

Returns:None
x_axis = <c3py.axes.XAxis object>¶
y2_axis = <c3py.axes.YAxis object>¶
y_axis = <c3py.axes.YAxis object>¶
class c3py.axes.XAxis¶

Bases: c3py.axes.Axis

Manipulate the chart’s x axis.

set_height(height)¶

Set the height of the x axis, in pixels.

Parameters:height (int) – The desired height of the x axis, in pixels.
Returns:None
set_type(axis_type)¶

Set the type of the x axis.

Parameters:axis_type (str; [‘indexed’ | ‘category’| ‘timeseries’]) – The type of the x axis.
Returns:None
class c3py.axes.YAxis¶

Bases: c3py.axes.Axis

Manipulate the chart’s y axis.

class c3py.axes.Axis(axis_dimension)¶

Manipulate an individual axis.

Parameters:axis_dimension (str; [‘x’ | ‘y’]) – The dimension of the axis.
label = <c3py.axes.AxisLabel object>¶
padding = <c3py.axes.AxisPadding object>¶
set_range(minimum, maximum)¶

Set the range of values for the axis.

Parameters:
  • minimum (int | float) – The minimum value for the axis.
  • maximum (int | float) – The maximum value for the axis.
Returns:

None
set_range_max(maximum)¶

Set the maximum value for the axis.

Parameters:maximum (int | float) – The maximum value for the axis.
Returns:None
set_range_min(minimum)¶

Set the minimum value for the axis.

Parameters:minimum (int | float) – The minimum value for the axis.
Returns:None
set_visibility(visible)¶

Show or hide the axis.

Parameters:visible (bool) – Whether or not the axis should be visible.
Returns:None
ticks = <c3py.ticks.Ticks object>¶
class c3py.axes.AxisPadding(axis)¶

Manipulate the padding of the axis.

N.B. padding refers to the distance between the last tick of the axis and the end of the axis itself.

Parameters:axis (c3py.axes.Axis) – The axis object which this padding applies to.
set(location, padding_amount)¶

Set the axis padding.

Parameters:
  • location (str; x: [‘left’ | ‘right’]; y: [‘bottom’ | ‘top’]) – Which end of the axis to pad.
  • padding_amount (int | float) – The amount by which to pad the axis. For the y axis, this is in pixels. For the x axis, this is in the units of the axis.
class c3py.axes.AxisLabel(axis)¶

Manipulate the label of the axis.

Parameters:axis (c3py.axes.Axis) – The axis object which this label applies to.
set(label_text, label_position=None)¶

Set the axis label.

Parameters:
  • label_text (str) – The text for the axis label.
  • label_position (str; default = None; x: [‘inner-right’ | ‘inner-center’ | ‘inner-left’ | ‘outer-right’ | ‘outer-center’ | ‘outer-left’]; y: [‘inner-top’ | ‘inner-middle’ | ‘inner-bottom’ | ‘outer-top’ | ‘outer-middle’ | ‘outer-bottom’]) – The position of the axis label.
Returns:

None
